item.title: Undergraduate Instruction
item.description:
Undergraduate Instruction (2006 - 2013)

Total Teaching Hours: 850+ contact hours

University of Paris-Est Créteil (2011 - 2013)

Core Courses Taught

  • Signal Processing: Digital signal processing, Fourier analysis, filter design
  • Probability and Statistics: Statistical inference, hypothesis testing, regression analysis
  • Machine Learning Foundations: Introduction to supervised and unsupervised learning

Teaching Responsibilities

  • Co-supervised two Ph.D. candidates in reinforcement learning for wireless networks
  • Developed and delivered 768+ hours of instruction across multiple courses
  • Created practical laboratory exercises and hands-on programming assignments
  • Supervised 15+ undergraduate research projects

IUT d’Orsay (2006 - 2011)

Technical Courses

  • Object-Oriented Programming: Java, C++, software design patterns
  • Database Design: SQL, relational database concepts, database optimization
  • Software Engineering: Development methodologies, version control, testing

Course Development

  • Designed comprehensive programming curricula for computer science students
  • Created practical labs emphasizing real-world software development skills
  • Developed assessment methods combining theoretical knowledge with practical application

Teaching Approach

Pedagogical Methods

  • Hands-On Learning: Emphasis on practical programming and problem-solving
  • Project-Based Learning: Students work on real-world projects throughout the semester
  • Incremental Complexity: Building from fundamental concepts to advanced applications
  • Industry Preparation: Focus on skills directly applicable in professional settings

Student Support

  • Regular office hours for individual student consultation
  • Collaborative learning environments encouraging peer-to-peer knowledge sharing
  • Mentorship for students interested in pursuing graduate studies
  • Career guidance and industry connection facilitation

Impact and Outcomes

  • Successfully prepared hundreds of students for careers in technology and engineering
  • Many former students have pursued advanced degrees in machine learning and AI
  • Established lasting connections between academic curriculum and industry needs
  • Contributed to curriculum modernization efforts across multiple institutions
